Action: # Report Export: Report Export Journal
report_export/report_export_journal
## Facet Export

Go to the journal search page in the admin area

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/

Expected Test Results: At the bottom of the list of facets is a "Reporting Tools" section

Action: Click on "Export Data as CSV"

Expected Test Results: An export section expands which includes a section to "download the current facets"

Action: Open the pull-down menu of facets to download

Expected Test Results: At the top there is an "All" option
Listed beneath the "All" option are all the facets that appear on the search page

Action: Select an individual facet (e.g. "Created Date Histogram") and click "Download"

Expected Test Results: Your are offered a download box for a csv
The filename reflects the facet you selected

Action: Save the CSV to your computer
Open the CSV in a spreadsheet program

Expected Test Results: The CSV contains meta information on the date of the export and the search URL used
The CSV contains the data that was displayed in the facet on the search page

Action: Go back to the journal search page in the admin area, and go to the facet export section
Select "All" from the pull-down list of facets and click "Download"

Expected Test Results: Your are offered a download box for a csv
The filename reflects that all facets have been selected

Action: Save the CSV to your computer
Open the CSV in a spreadsheet program

Expected Test Results: The CSV contains meta information on the date of the export and the search URL used
The CSV contains the data that was displayed in all the facets on the search page

Action: ## Date range histograms

Go to the journal search page in the admin area

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/

Expected Test Results: At the bottom of the list of facets is a "Reporting Tools" section, including 3 options for working with dates "limit by date range", "created date histogram" and "last update histogram"

Action: Click on "Created Date Histogram"

Expected Test Results: A histogram of the number of journals created per day for the entire life of the DOAJ is displayed, grouped by year

Action: Click on one of the years

Expected Test Results: The search updates, and only records created in that year are displayed
The search filter list at the top of the results indicates the created date range (it may indicate the start and end months of the year)

Action: Go back to the Created Date Histogram facet, and change the "Granularity" from "Year" to "Month"

Expected Test Results: The histogram updates to show the number of journals created per month for the selected year

Action: Click on one of the months

Expected Test Results: The search updates, and only records created in that month are displayed
The search filter list at the top of the results indicates the selected month

Action: Go back to the Created Date Histogram facet.  Above it is the "Limit by Date Range" facet, open this by clicking on it

Expected Test Results: The "Limit by Date Range" facet opens, showing a date range picker
Beneath the date range picker the "Created Date" month you selected is also shown

Action: Remove the Created Date limit by clicking the "X" either in the "Limit by Date Range" section or at the top of the search results

Expected Test Results: The search results update to show all records

Action: Repeat the above steps for the "Last Update Histogram"
## Date range limiting

Go to the journal search page in the admin area

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/

Expected Test Results: At the bottom of the list of facets is a "Reporting Tools" section, including 3 options for working with dates "limit by date range", "created date histogram" and "last update histogram"

Action: Click on "Limit by Date Range"

Expected Test Results: A date range picker is displayed

Action: Open the "Type" pull-down menu

Expected Test Results: The options are "Created Date" and "Last Updated"

Action: If not already selected, select "Created Date"

Expected Test Results: The From and To dates show the month and year of the earliest and latest created dates in the search results, respectively

Action: Change the "Type" to "Last Updated"

Expected Test Results: The From and To dates show the month and year of the earliest and latest last updated dates in the search results, respectively
Note that January 1970 is the date used for records with no last updated date

Action: Select a new Year value for the Last Updated date range and click "Apply"

Expected Test Results: The search results update to show only records that have been updated in the selected range
The search filter list at the top of the results indicates the last updated date range, including the month and year
The "Limit by Date Range" facet also shows the search filter for the Last Updated date range

Action: Try changing the month and year in both From and To fields for Last Updated in the same way

Expected Test Results: The search results and displayed filters reflect the new date ranges

Action: Choose a "To" date that is earlier than the "From" date

Expected Test Results: The "Apply" button is disabled

Action: Change the "Type" back to "Created Date"
Select a new range for the Created date range and click "Apply"

Expected Test Results: The "Last Updated" date filter is still active
The search results update to show only records that have been created in the selected range (and were updated in the selected range)
The search filter list at the top of the results indicates the created date range and the last updated range, including the month and year
The "Limit by Date Range" facet also shows the search filter for the Created date range and the last updated range

Action: Remove both the Created Date and Last Updated date ranges by clicking the "X" in the "Limit by Date Range" section

Expected Test Results: The search results update to show all records

Action: ## Export Search as CSV

Go to the journal search page in the admin area

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/

Expected Test Results: At the bottom of the list of facets is a "Reporting Tools" section, including 3 options for working with dates "limit by date range", "created date histogram" and "last update histogram"

Action: Open the "Limit by Date Range" facet and set a date range which gives you a subset of the data
Apply any other filters from the facets to further refine the search results
Click on "Export Data as CSV"

Expected Test Results: An export section expands which includes a section to export the search results

Action: Enter a name for the export in the input box and click "Generate"

Expected Test Results: a pop-up appears with a message that the export is being generated

Action: Close the popup

Go to the background jobs page in the admin area

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/background_jobs

Expected Test Results: The export job is listed with the name "admin_reports by [your username]" (it may have a status of queued or processing, or even complete)

Action: Wait for the job to complete (this can take up to 10 minutes).  You will need to refresh the page until it is in the "complete" status.
Open your "Notifications" menu at the top of the page

Expected Test Results: A notification appears that the report is ready for download
A second notification saying a background job is finished will also be present

Action: Click on the notification that the report is ready for download

Expected Test Results: A download box appears for the CSV file
The filename reflects the name you gave the export and the date requested

Action: Save the CSV to your computer
Open the CSV in a spreadsheet program

Expected Test Results: The CSV contains the data that was displayed in the search results
The CSV is the "admin" CSV, not the "public" CSV.  You can tell this because the final 3 columns include account information

Action: ## Manage existing reports

Step Number: Depends on Report Export : Report Export Journal : Export Search as CSV

Action: Ensure you have exported at least one CSV from the search results as per the "Export Search as CSV" test

Go to the report search page.  This can be found at the bottom of the admin left navigation.

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/reports

Expected Test Results: The page lists all the reports that have been generated by any user

Action: Select a "journal" report, and click on "Search again"

Expected Test Results: The journal search page opens with the same filters as the report you selected (but not necessarily the same results)

Action: Go back to the report search page
Select a report, and click on "Download report"

Expected Test Results: A download box appears for the CSV file
The filename reflects the name you gave the export and the date requested

Action: Save the CSV to your computer
Open the CSV in a spreadsheet program

Expected Test Results: The CSV contains the data that was displayed in the search results
The CSV is the "admin" CSV, not the "public" CSV.  You can tell this because the final 3 columsn include account information

Action: Go back to the report search page
Try out the facets and the sorting and searching options on this page

Expected Test Results: The page works as expected, and you can find the report you are looking for
